Migrants who spent the last two weeks walking toward the U.S border from Central America are taking a day off from their long trek north and here is Carrie Kahn reports the numbers have dwindled in recent days but still number in the thousands
Nursing blistered feed and dehydration the migrants decided to rest instead of forged forward so stifling heat
Now in the southern state of ... Mexican federal officials are alternating
Helping and at times impeding the marchers Saturday federal police temporarily blocked the migrants pass on the highway officials say they reiterated enough are made by Mexico's president to grant the migrants work permits access to local schools and medical care more than one hundred mostly elderly and women with children opt to just stay
It's unclear where and when the migrants will reach the U. S.
